channel.title: 2 questions i want anwser on
channel.description:
here are 2 questions i want anwser on..... please reply
first question : im using testscape source and im putting my rights to 3 (that means im gonna be owner )
and....i dont see my crown in-game -.- can anyone help please?
second question : where the hell do i add objects?

item.title: 2 questions i want anwser on
item.dc:creator: @Haxor_X Haxor X
item.description:
@Haxor_X wrote:

ok reborn is right it doesn’t work for testscape the same way…thats one of the reasons i don’t use it anymore…

Read full topic

item.title: 2 questions i want anwser on
item.dc:creator: @_R_E_B_O_R_N ~R E B O R N~
item.description:
@_R_E_B_O_R_N wrote:

[quote=“Taylor John0, post:7, topic:110283”][quote author=newton37 link=topic=157636.msg1481808#msg1481808 date=1181781983]
First off, you go into the characters folder in your source folder, click the account name of yours and change the character rights to 3.
Then, you must compile your server by clicking compile.bat.
Lastly, start your server.

(NOTE: it wont work if your server is running so be sure to turn it off.)

                                                     ~Newton37

[/quote]
totally wrong
don’t have to compile or turn server off
person’s gotta be OFFLINE
edit the file then save it

most servers u can’t see ur crown as owner, might be tut on that in tut section[/quote]

You both are wrong, you dont go in a characters folder to edit their account’s rights on testscape, thats for other sources Lol, not testscape.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 questions i want anwser on
item.dc:creator: @Haxor_X Haxor X
item.description:
@Haxor_X wrote:

mine wasn’t wrong…mine was completely right…i used testscape before…
and making someone admin is when you change the rights to 3…

Read full topic

item.title: 2 questions i want anwser on
item.dc:creator: @cawagula cawagula
item.description:
@cawagula wrote:

Not really, depends what source your running. If it’s set up in your client.java then you add it there as well as your player rights in the save game file. But, I know for my old source even if you set it up in client.java, and the player save file it wouldn’t show up on your own screen. It would only appear to other players, the only way to fix it was to set your player rights to 2 rather then 3.

3 = owner
2 = admin
1 = mod
0 = player

So pretty much 3 and 2 are the same anyway, just change any owner only rights to admin and your good.

Read full topic
